results.title: Open doors ... opportunities in trade training for women
results.brief_description: Interviews with women apprentices show the opportunities in various trades; they are training to be nursery attendants, motor mechanics, plumbers, refrigeration mechanics, and optical glass makers. They speak about career prospects, work satisfaction and attitudes towards female apprentices. No other credits available.
results.title_for_label: Open doors … opportunities in trade training for women

results.title: Through a looking glass; Drama is -
results.creator_credit: Vincent O'Donnell and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Two drama education programs: “Through a looking glass” shows the major concepts underlaying drama in education and how the teacher can participate with the student in the dramatic process. “Drama is -” explores the ways in which drama can be used as a method to teach many subject areas.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vincent O’Donnell and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Getting into jeans
results.creator_credit: Paul Wingate, Chris Strange, Ross D Wylie and AVCOM Productions
results.brief_description: Graeme (Shirley) Strachan presents an overview of the production of a pair of jeans from the beginning of the design process through to the sale to the customer. Shows the function of computers in laying out pattern pieces to the material available, the machinist at work, and the activity of wholesalers and retailers.

results.title: Making your mind up
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke, George Cass and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Indicates the wide application of word processors in office environments and the sorts of prerequisites the personnel officers seek when interviewing applicants for typing and word processing positions.

results.title: You Can Do It Too!
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: A character called “x”, who is neither male nor female, points out all the opportunities available to people when gender is made irrelevant. Shows how role stereotyping begins at birth and carries through into school and work. Shows men and women working and finding fulfilment in non-traditional areas. The band playing towards the end of the film features the now ABC political journalist, Fran Kelly, in an unfamiliar guise.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Diane O’Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Just a story
results.creator_credit: Barbara Boyd-Anderson, Diane O'Connor, Tony Paice and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: An attempt to show that storytelling is not just part of literature but is part of the everyday world around us and the ways in which we relate to each other. Demonstrates that our own experiences provide a rich source of information which may be drawn upon for the writing of stories.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barbara Boyd-Anderson, Diane O’Connor, Tony Paice and Victoria. Ministry of Education

results.title: No. 1 On the Charts : A Look at the Australian Pop Music Industry
results.creator_credit: Don Fitzsimmons, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Lee Simon, Basia Bonkowski, Jane Clifton and Michael Gudinski are interviewed in a forum style program about their views on the presentation of popular culture in the media. Video clips are interposed throughout the program.

results.title: Going outside: to play, to imagine, to learn
results.creator_credit: Rick Cavaggion and Open College of Further Education (S. Aust.)
results.brief_description: Outlines ways in which teachers can develop children’s awareness of the natural environment. In a bush setting, five to eleven-year-olds role play the Dam Conflict Game, learning how to become involved in an issue and how to communicate their feelings.
results.title_for_label: Going outside: to play, to imagine, to learn

results.title: You've got to start somewhere
results.creator_credit: Chris Warner, Maureen McCarthy and Trout Films
results.brief_description: Focuses on a multicultural project at Ferntree Gully Primary School to show what teachers at schools with low migrant populations can do to put the philosophy of education in a multicultural society into practice.
